overview:
Marcus is a Fellow of the Royal Australian College of General Practitioners, the Australian Institute of Company Directors and holds an Executive MBA from the Australian Graduate School of Management.

A medical graduate from the University of Western Australia, Marcus is a well-regarded clinician qualified in General Practice and with a special interest in skin cancer and minor procedures.

He has previously served as a Medical Director for Australia’s leading and largest skin cancer clinic group. Concurrently, he was a director on the board of GP Coastal Division of General Practice for six years and Chairman for three terms, leading a successful merger in 2007 to form the Perth Primary Care Network (PPCN) which is now recognised as the largest Division of General Practice in Western Australia and one of the leading Divisions in Australia.

When not working clinically, Marcus works as a management consultant with Equis Consulting Group, a boutique management consultancy he co-founded in 2007 that creates ethical and quality business solutions to health care industry challenges. His key areas of commercial expertise and interest include strategic planning and management, marketing and business development, facilitation and training, corporate advisory and governance, capital raising, and angel investing.

Marcus has a wide network of contacts within the Australian health and business community and has experience with large and small private, public, government, and not-for-profit sectors. He is also a strong believer in giving back and is a co-founder and director of Meridian Global Foundation, a professional philanthropic group and charitable trust.

Marcus is married with two young sons. As a keen traveler, he has set foot on every continent in the world including Antarctica. His other pastimes include snow skiing, reading, golf, and badminton.
